title: "Travel Itineraries"
output: html_document
---

```{r, results = 'asis', echo = F}

options(knitr.kable.NA = '')

# this code parses the names of the flight itineraries in this year's folder and generates a table with the person's name, what legs they are one, and the confirmation code. Files must be named with the following information in this order: NAME_Leg1_2_CONFIRMATIONCODE

this_year <- format(x = Sys.Date(), format = "%Y")

flights_dir <- "./files/Travel/flight itineraries/"

year <- as.numeric(this_year)
# year <- ifelse(test = this_year %in% list.dirs(path = flights_dir, 
#                                                full.names = F, 
#                                                recursive = F),
#                yes = as.numeric(x = this_year),
#                no = as.numeric(x = this_year) - 1)

path0 <- paste0(flights_dir, year)
travel_plans <- stringr::str_remove(string = dir(path = paste0(".", path0), 
                                                 recursive = TRUE, 
                                                 full.names = TRUE), 
                                    pattern = paste0(paste0(".", path0, "/")))


tmp_table <- tibble(full_file = travel_plans) %>%
  tidyr::separate(full_file, c("survey", "file"), sep = "/", remove = FALSE) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(file = tools::file_path_sans_ext(x = gsub(pattern = " ", 
                                                          replacement = "_", 
                                                          x = file))) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(Name = str_extract(file, "^[A-Za-z]+"),
                `Leg 1` = ifelse(grepl("l1|_l.+1", tolower(file)), "x", ""), 
                `Leg 2` = ifelse(grepl("l2|_l.+2", tolower(file)), "x", ""), 
                `Leg 3` = ifelse(grepl("l3|_l.+3", tolower(file)), "x", ""), 
                `Leg 4` = ifelse(grepl("l4|_l.+4", tolower(file)), "x", ""), 
                Conf_No = str_extract(file, "[A-Za-z]+$"),
                Link = paste0("[travel info](../", path0, 
                              gsub(pattern = " ",
                                   replacement = "%20", 
                                   x = full_file), 
                              ")")) 

tabl <- tmp_table %>%
  dplyr::select(Name, Survey = survey, `Leg 1`:Link) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(ord = case_when(
    `Leg 1`== "x" & `Leg 2`!= "x" ~ 1,
    `Leg 1`== "x" & `Leg 2`== "x" ~ 2,
    `Leg 2`== "x" & `Leg 3`!= "x" ~ 3,
    `Leg 2`== "x" & `Leg 3`== "x" ~ 4,
    `Leg 3`== "x" & `Leg 4`!= "x" ~ 5,
    `Leg 3`== "x" & `Leg 4`== "x" ~ 6,
    `Leg 4` == "x" ~ 7
  )) %>%
  dplyr::arrange(ord, Name) %>%
  dplyr::filter(!duplicated(.[,1:4])) %>%
  dplyr::select(-ord) %>%
  split(.$Survey)

surveys <- names(x = tabl)
surveys[toupper(x = surveys) == "EBS"] <- "Bering Sea"
surveys[toupper(x = surveys) == "GOA"] <- "Gulf of Alaska"
surveys[toupper(x = surveys) == "AI"] <- "Aleutian Islands"


cat(paste("##", year, "Survey Year"), '\n\n')

for(i in 1:length(x = surveys)){
  
  cat(paste("###", surveys[i]), '\n\n')
  g <- tabl[[i]] %>% 
    dplyr::select(-Survey)
  print(kableExtra::kable(g, format = "html", linesep = "",
                          align = c("l", rep("c",4),"l")))
  cat("\n")
  
}

rm(g, page_dat, tabl, tmp_table,i, page_desc, page_title, path0, surveys, this_year, year, travel_plans, dir)
```
